intro: Delastrea bojeri, commonly known as the Bojer's anemone, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It has a compact growth habit with dark green, lance-shaped leaves and produces attractive, clustered blooms. Delastrea bojeri is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
